definition: men, women, young and old/all kinds of people/people of all ages
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: All the people,men and women,old and young have plunged into war in the wartime.
sentences.chinese: 戰時所有男女老少都投入到戰爭中去。

sentences.english: Men, women and children are put on the family holiday attire, followed by the seated position in the family hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 全家男女老少都穿上節日的盛裝，按輩分依次坐定。

sentences.english: Men and women lined up at the Fair Price Shop in the village of Ban.
sentences.chinese: 在坂村，男女老少在國營平價糧店外排隊等候着。

sentences.english: A  Concerning physical exercise, American men and women, boys and girls, generally fall into one of two categories.
sentences.chinese: 關於體育鍛煉，美國男女老少，基本上可分爲兩類。

sentences.english: Kinds of men and women you come, I come to steal is too busy.
sentences.chinese: 男女老少你來種，我來偷，忙得不亦樂乎。

sentences.english: City folk and country folk, old and young, men and women, rubbed shoulders at the annual commodity fair.
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的商品展覽會上擠滿了來自城鄉的男女老少。

sentences.english: Young and old compete in lantern contests and 1 competitions.
sentences.chinese: 男女老少進行彩燈比賽和猜燈謎比賽。

sentences.english: Men and women, old and young, all pitched into the work.

the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
